snippet: Leaders of the financially ailing city have opposed a state takeover, but the compromise proposed by the governor’s office also seemed unlikely to win their approval.
abstract: Detroit city officials criticize Michigan state restructuring deal that would establish a fiscal oversight panel to address city's financial problems, saying it circumvents role and power of City Council; city has more than $12 billion in long-term debt and a general deficit of $196 million; standoff over fiscal problems is likely to continue.
lead_paragraph: Leaders of the financially ailing city have opposed a state takeover, but the compromise proposed by the governor’s office also seemed unlikely to win their approval.

headline.seo: Detroit Officials Criticize State’s Fiscal Proposal
headline.main: Detroit Officials Criticize State’s Proposal for Fiscal Oversight Panel
headline.print_headline: Detroit Officials Criticize State’s Proposal for Fiscal Oversight Panel
